member.summary: Convert the source image in place (no copy is made).

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.ColorResolutionCommandMode.CreateDestinationImage
member.summary: Create a new image, leaving the source image unchanged. The ColorResolutionCommand.DestinationImage will hold the converted RasterImage.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.ColorResolutionCommandMode.OnlyData
member.summary: Only provide the converted data in the ColorResolutionCommand.Data event.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.ColorResolutionCommandMode.AllPages
member.summary: Process all pages in the source image.

member.name: T:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.ColorResolutionCommandPaletteFlags
member.summary: Palette options, for the ColorResolutionCommand.PaletteFlags property.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.ColorResolutionCommandPaletteFlags.None
member.summary: Default.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.ColorResolutionCommandPaletteFlags.Fixed
member.summary: Use the LEAD Fixed palette.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.ColorResolutionCommandPaletteFlags.Optimized
member.summary: Create an optimized palette, or if you supply a palette in ColorResolutionCommand.SetPalette, supply optimized colors for specified entries in the palette.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.ColorResolutionCommandPaletteFlags.Identity
member.summary: Insert the Windows system palette.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.ColorResolutionCommandPaletteFlags.UsePalette
member.summary: Use the palette specified in ColorResolutionCommand.SetPalette, without supplying optimized colors.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.ColorResolutionCommandPaletteFlags.FastMatch
member.summary: Use a predefined table to speed conversion using your own palette. Refer to RasterUserMatchTable.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.ColorResolutionCommandPaletteFlags.Netscape
member.summary: Use the fixed palette that is employed by Netscape Navigator and by Microsoft Internet Explorer.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.ColorResolutionCommandPaletteFlags.SlowMatch
member.summary: Use with Optimized to use a slower but more accurate matching process.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.ColorResolutionCommandPaletteFlags.FavorPureColors
member.summary: Give colors that occur frequently in the image palette entries of their own in the optimized palette.

member.name: T:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.CombineFastCommandFlags
member.summary: Flags for the CombineFastCommand.Flags.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.CombineFastCommandFlags.None
member.summary: No change. Part of the group of flags that define treatment of the source rectangle.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.CombineFastCommandFlags.SourceNot
member.summary: Invert the color, resulting in its complement. Part of the group of flags that define treatment of the source rectangle.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.CombineFastCommandFlags.Source0
member.summary: Change all bits to 0. Part of the group of flags that define treatment of the source rectangle.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.CombineFastCommandFlags.Source1
member.summary: Change all bits to 1. Part of the group of flags that define treatment of the source rectangle.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.CombineFastCommandFlags.DestinationNot
member.summary: Invert the color, resulting in its complement. Part of the group of flags that define treatment of the destination rectangle.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.CombineFastCommandFlags.Destination0
member.summary: Change all bits to 0. Part of the group of flags that define treatment of the destination rectangle.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.CombineFastCommandFlags.Destination1
member.summary: Change all bits to 1. Part of the group of flags that define treatment of the destination rectangle.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.CombineFastCommandFlags.OperationOr
member.summary: Combine each set of bytes using a bitwise OR ( ¦ ). Part of the group of flags that define the operation to use when combining the data.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.CombineFastCommandFlags.SourceCopy
member.summary: Copies the source image to the destination image.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.CombineFastCommandFlags.OperationXor
member.summary: Combine each set of bytes using a bitwise exclusive OR (^). Part of the group of flags that define the operation to use when combining the data.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.CombineFastCommandFlags.OperationAdd
member.summary: Add the byte values, allowing a maximum of 255. Part of the group of flags that define the operation to use when combining the data.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.CombineFastCommandFlags.OperationSubtractSource
member.summary: Subtract the source from the destination, allowing a minimum of 0. Part of the group of flags that define the operation to use when combining the data.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.CombineFastCommandFlags.OperationSubtractDestination
member.summary: Subtract the destination from the source, allowing a minimum of 0. Part of the group of flags that define the operation to use when combining the data.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.CombineFastCommandFlags.OperationMultiply
member.summary: Multiply the byte values, allowing a maximum of 255. The result is calculated as follows: result = (source * dest) / 255. Part of the group of flags that define the operation to use when combining the data.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.CombineFastCommandFlags.OperationDivideSource
member.summary: Divide the destination by the source. If source > 0, then the result is calculated as follows: result = min( (dest / source) * 255, 255 ). Otherwise, if source = 0, then result = 255. Part of the group of flags that define the operation to use when combining the data.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.CombineFastCommandFlags.OperationDivideDestination
member.summary: Divide the source by the destination. If dest > 0, then the result is calculated as follows: result = min( (source / dest) * 255, 255 ). Otherwise, if dest = 0, then result = 255. Part of the group of flags that define the operation to use when combining the data.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.CombineFastCommandFlags.OperationAverage
member.summary: Use the average of the two values. Part of the group of flags that define the operation to use when combining the data.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.CombineFastCommandFlags.OperationMinimum
member.summary: Use the lesser of the two values. Part of the group of flags that define the operation to use when combining the data.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.CombineFastCommandFlags.OperationMaximum
member.summary: Use the greater of the two values. Part of the group of flags that define the operation to use when combining the data.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.CombineFastCommandFlags.ResultNot
member.summary: Invert the color, resulting in its complement. Part of the group of flags that define treatment of the resulting image rectangle.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.CombineFastCommandFlags.Result0
member.summary: Change all bits to 0. Part of the group of flags that define treatment of the resulting image rectangle.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.CombineFastCommandFlags.Result1
member.summary: Change all bits to 1. Part of the group of flags that define treatment of the resulting image rectangle.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Factory

member.summary: Creates a disk file for writing as an ILeadStream object.
member.param: Path to the file on disk.
member.returns: ILeadStream object. This method returns an instance of LeadFileStream.

member.summary: Wraps a .NET `System.IO.Stream` as an ILeadStream object.
member.param: .NET `System.IO.Stream` object to use. This value will be set into the LeadStream.Stream property.
member.returns: ILeadStream object. This method returns an instance of LeadStream.

member.summary: Wraps a URL as an ILeadStream object.
member.param: .NET `Uri` containing the path to the remote resource. This value will be set into the HttpClientLeadStream.Uri property.
member.returns: ILeadStream object. This method returns an instance of HttpClientLeadStream.

member.summary: Opens a disk file for reading as an ILeadStream object.
member.param: Path to the file on disk.
member.returns: ILeadStream object. This method returns an instance of LeadFileStream.

member.summary: Releases all the resources used by this LeadStream.

member.name: M:Leadtools.LeadStream.Finalize
member.summary: Overrides `Finalize`.

member.name: P:Leadtools.LeadStream.DisposeStream
member.summary: Determine whether the underlying framework stream should be disposed when this LeadStream is disposed.
member.value: **true** if the underlying framework `Stream` should be disposed when this LeadStreamdisposes; otherwise, **false**.

member.name: P:Leadtools.LeadStream.IsOpen
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates if the stream is open.
member.value: ***true*** if the stream is open; otherwise, ***false***

member.name: P:Leadtools.LeadStream.Stream
member.summary: Gets the underlying framework stream associated with this LeadStream.
member.value: The underlying framework stream associated with this LeadStream. The stream is of type `System.IO.Stream` in .NET.

member.name: T:Leadtools.LeadtoolsException
member.summary: Base class for all exception classes thrown by LEADTOOLS.

member.name: M:Leadtools.LeadtoolsException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LeadtoolsException class with its Exception.Message string set to the empty string ("") and its inner exception set to a null reference.

member.name: M:Leadtools.LeadtoolsException.#ctor(SerializationInfo,StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LeadtoolsException class with the specified serialization and context information.
member.param: The data for serializing or de-serializing the object.
The source and destination for the object.

member.name: M:Leadtools.LeadtoolsException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LeadtoolsException class with its Exception.Message string set to *message* parameter, and its inner exception set to a null reference.
member.param: A String that describes the error. The content of message is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.

member.name: M:Leadtools.LeadtoolsException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LeadtoolsException class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the innerException parameter is not a **null** reference, the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.

member.summary: Calculates the size required for output buffer.

BitsPerPixel of the input image data.

member.summary: Converts data in the specified buffer to the specified bits per pixel and color order.
member.param: The input buffer.
The zero-based offset into the \buffer\ where conversion should start.
Width in pixels of the input image data.
BitsPerPixel of the input image data.
BitsPerPixel of the desired output image data.
The input color order.
The output color order.
The palette or 8-bit LUT for the existing data, before conversion. If the input data is not palettized and not grayscale, use NULL.

The alpha value if the destination bits per pixel contains an alpha component

The palette for the converted data. If the data is converted to 16 or 24 bits per pixel color, use NULL for no palette.
The 16-bit LUT for the existing data, before conversion. Use NULL for no 16-bit LUT.
The 16-bit LUT for the converted data. Reserved for future use. Use NULL.
Value indicating the low bit in the source buffer, if the source buffer contains grayscale data.
Value indicating the high bit in the source buffer, if the source buffer contains grayscale data.
The alpha value if the destination bits per pixel contains an alpha component
Flags indicating whether to treat 16 bit data as grayscale or color.

member.summary: Creates or updates the image region by adding a Bézier region.
member.param: RasterRegionXForm object that LEADTOOLS uses to translate between display coordinates and image coordinates. If you specify **null** in this parameter, the scalar fields default to 1, the offsets default to 0, and the view perspective defaults to the image view perspective.

A collection of LeadPoint objects. The points in the collection must be in the order in which the vertices of the polygon are connected. To create the line that closes the polygon, the last point in the collection is connected to the first point of the collection.
Indicates how to handle complex crossing lines.
The action to take regarding the existing image region, if one is defined.

Indicates how to handle complex crossing lines.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImage.AddCurveToRegion(Leadtools.RasterRegionXForm,Leadtools.LeadPoint,System.Single,Leadtools.LeadFillMode,Leadtools.RasterRegionCombineMode)
member.summary: Creates or updates the image region by adding a curved region.
member.param: RasterRegionXForm object that LEADTOOLS uses to translate between display coordinates and image coordinates. If you specify **null** in this parameter, the scalar fields default to 1, the offsets default to 0, and the view perspective defaults to the image view perspective.

Collection of LeadPoint objects. The points in the array must be in the order in which the vertices of the polygon are connected. To create the line that closes the polygon, the last point in the array is connected to the first point of the array.
A value that specifies the amount that the curve bends between control points. Values greater than 1 produce unpredictable results.
Indicates how to handle complex crossing lines.
The action to take regarding the existing image region, if one is defined.

A value that specifies the amount that the curve bends between control points. Values greater than 1 produce unpredictable results.
Indicates how to handle complex crossing lines.
The action to take regarding the existing image region, if one is defined.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImage.GetRowColumnCompressed(System.Byte[],System.UInt16[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a row (or part of a row) of 1-bit compressed data from an image that has been loaded in its compressed format.
member.param: Optional work buffer. Allocating the work buffer speeds processing if you call this method more than once, because if you do not allocate a work buffer, the method allocates and frees a temporary buffer each time it is called. The size of this buffer should be the same as the BytesPerLine property. Pass a **null** reference to \runBuffer\ if you do not want to use a work buffer.
The output buffer, which will be filled with 1-bit compressed image data. Calculate the required size of this buffer as follows: bytes required = (Width + 3) \* 2.
Index into \runBuffer\ where the get operation should start.
The number of the row to retrieve. The first row is 0, and the last row is 1 less than the image height.
The column offset within the row to retrieve. The first column offset is 0, and the last column offset is 1 less than the image width.
The number of pixels to retrieve.
member.returns: The number of pixels processed.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImage.GetRowColumnCompressed(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves (into an unmanaged memory buffer) a row (or part of a row) of 1-bit compressed data from an image that has been loaded in its compressed format.
member.param: Pointer to optional unmanaged memory work buffer. Allocating the work buffer speeds processing if you call this method more than once, because if you do not allocate a work buffer, the method allocates and frees a temporary buffer each time it is called. The size of this buffer should be the same as the BytesPerLine property. Pass IntPtr.Zero for \workBuffer\ if you do not want to use the work buffer
Pointer to the output unmanaged memory buffer, which will be filled with 1-bit compressed image data. Calculate the required size of this buffer as follows: bytes required = (Width + 3) \* 2.
The number of the row to retrieve. The first row is 0, and the last row is 1 less than the image height.
The column offset within the row to retrieve. The first column offset is 0, and the last column offset is 1 less than the image width.
The number of pixels to retrieve.
member.returns: The number of pixels processed.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImage.GetRowCompressed(System.Byte[],System.UInt16[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves one or more rows of 1-bit compressed data from an image that has been loaded in its compressed format.
member.param: Optional work buffer. Allocating the work buffer speeds processing if you call this method more than once, because if you do not allocate a work buffer, the method allocates and frees a temporary buffer each time it is called. bytes required = \lines\ \* ((RasterImage-Width.md) + 3) \* 2). Pass a **null** reference to \runBuffer\ if you do not want to use a work buffer.
The output buffer, which will be filled with 1-bit compressed image data.
Offset into \runBuffer\ where the copy operation should start.
The number of the row to retrieve. The first row is 0, and the last row is 1 less than the image height.
Number of rows to retrieve.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImage.GetRowCompressed(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves (into an unmanaged memory buffer) one or more rows of 1-bit compressed data from an image that has been loaded in its compressed format.

Allocating the work buffer speeds processing if you call this method more than once, because if you do not allocate a work buffer, the method allocates and frees a temporary buffer each time it is called. bytes required = \lines\ \* ((RasterImage-Width.md) + 3) \* 2). Pass IntPtr.Zero for \workBuffer\ if you do not want to use the work buffer
Pointer to the output unmanaged memory buffer, which will be filled with 1-bit compressed image data.
The number of the row to retrieve. The first row is 0, and the last row is 1 less than the image height.
Number of rows to retrieve.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImage.SetRowColumnCompressed(System.Byte[],System.UInt16[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Puts a row (or part of a row) of 1-bit compressed data from a buffer into an image that is maintained in its compressed format.

Allocating the work buffer speeds processing if you call this method more than once, because if you do not allocate a work buffer, the method allocates and frees a temporary buffer each time it is called. Input buffer, which contains 1-bit compressed image data.
Offset into \runBuffer\ where the set operation should start.
The number of the row to update. The first row is 0, and the last row is 1 less than the image height.
The column offset within the row to update. The first column offset is 0, and the last column offset is 1 less than the image width.
The number of pixels to retrieve.
member.returns: The number of pixels processed.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImage.WindowLevel(System.Int32,System.Int32,Leadtools.RasterColor[],Leadtools.RasterWindowLevelMode)
member.summary: Sets up the paint or paint and image processing methods' window leveling options for this RasterImage
member.param: Value indicating the low bit used for leveling. 0 <= LowBit \<= HighBit <= (11 for 12-bit grayscale or 15 for 16-bit grayscale).
Value indicating the high bit used for leveling. 0 <= LowBit \<= HighBit <= (11 for 12-bit grayscale or 15 for 16-bit grayscale).

Optional 8-bit lookup table that can be used to implement a user defined conversion. For every intensity value between 0 and 2 raised to the power of (HighBit - LowBit + 1)-1 there should be a corresponding entry in the lookup table that contains a color. If \palette\ is **null**, the conversion is a normal shift (right or left) and the painted image is 8-bit grayscale. If \palette\ is not **null**, the painted image is a 24-bit image.
Value indicating whether \palette\ is used by the paint and image processing methods or only by the paint methods.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImage.WindowLevelExt(System.Int32,System.Int32,Leadtools.RasterColor16[],Leadtools.RasterWindowLevelMode)
member.summary: Sets up the paint or paint and image processing methods' window leveling options for this RasterImage
member.param: Value indicating the low bit used for leveling. 0 <= LowBit \<= HighBit <= (11 for 12-bit grayscale or 15 for 16-bit grayscale).
Value indicating the high bit used for leveling. 0 <= LowBit \<= HighBit <= (11 for 12-bit grayscale or 15 for 16-bit grayscale).

Optional 16-bit lookup table that can be used to implement a user defined conversion. For every intensity value between 0 and 2 raised to the power of (HighBit - LowBit + 1)-1 there should be a corresponding entry in the lookup table that contains a color. If \palette\ is **null**, the conversion is a normal shift (right or left) and the painted image is 8 or 16-bit grayscale. If \palette\ is not **null**, the painted image is a 48-bit image.
Value indicating whether \palette\ is used by the paint and image processing methods or only by the paint methods.

member.name: T:Leadtools.RasterImageAnimator
member.summary: Animates an image that has time-based frames.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImageAnimator.#ctor(Leadtools.RasterImage,Leadtools.RasterImage)
member.summary: Constructs a new RasterImageAnimator object using the specified parameters.
member.param: A RasterImage object referencing the target image.

A RasterImage object containing the frames to be played. This object must be a multi-frame image (The value of RasterImage.AnimationGlobalLoop must be something other than -1. You can also pass a **null** reference (Nothing in VisualBasic) to let the method create an empty multi-frame image.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImageAnimator.Append(Leadtools.RasterImage)
member.summary: Appends an image to the animated multi-frame image during an animation playback.
member.param: A RasterImage that contains 1 or more frames to be added to the animation.

member.summary: Cancels the wait for user input and any delay during an animation playback.

member.summary: Clears the update rectangle used for an animation playback, leaving an empty rectangle.

member.summary: Invalidates this RasterImageAnimator object and returns the animated image.
member.returns: A RasterImage object containing the multi-frame animated image.

member.returns: A LeadRect that this method will fill with the coordinates of the update rectangle.

member.name: T:Leadtools.RasterImageResize
member.summary: Provides support for resizing images.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImageResize.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new instance of the RasterImageResize class.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImageResize.ResizeBuffer(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves resized data, one line at a time.
member.param: The number of the row to retrieve. The first row is 0, and the last row is 1 less than the image Height.
The column offset within the row to retrieve. The first column offset is 0, and the last column offset is 1 less than the image Width.
The buffer to hold the image data that this method gets.
The zero-based index into \buffer\ where retrieving should start.
The number of bytes to retrieve. Consider the BitsPerPixel, and avoid specifying a number that goes past the end of the row.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImageResize.ResizeBuffer(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int64)
member.summary: Retrieves resized data in an unmanaged buffer, one line at a time.
member.param: The number of the row to retrieve. The first row is 0, and the last row is 1 less than the image Height.
The column offset within the row to retrieve. The first column offset is 0, and the last column offset is 1 less than the image Width.
The unmanaged buffer to hold the image data that this method gets.
The number of bytes to retrieve. Consider the BitsPerPixel, and avoid specifying a number that goes past the end of the row.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImageResize.Start(Leadtools.RasterImage,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Leadtools.RasterByteOrder,Leadtools.RasterDitheringMethod,Leadtools.RasterSizeFlags,Leadtools.RasterColor[])
member.summary: Sets up information for the ResizeBuffer method.
member.param: Image to be resized.
New width of the image data.
New height of the image data.
Output bits per pixel. Use 0 for 8-bit grayscale. Possible values are: 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 12, 16, 24, 32, 48 and 64.
Output color order.
Flags that indicate the type of dithering, if \bitsPerPixel\ is not the same as the source image.
Flags that indicate the type of resizing.
The palette to dither to if \bitsPerPixel\ is less than or equal to 8. Pass a **null** reference to dither to the fixed palette or if no palette is required.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterRegion.FromBeziers(Leadtools.RasterRegionXForm,Leadtools.LeadPoint,Leadtools.LeadFillMode)
member.summary: Creates a Bézier region.
member.param: RasterRegionXForm object that LEADTOOLS uses to translate between display coordinates and image coordinates. If you specify **null** in this parameter, the scalar fields default to 1, the offsets default to 0, and the view perspective defaults to the image view perspective.

A collection of LeadPoint objects. The points in the collection must be in the order in which the vertices of the polygon are connected. To create the line that closes the polygon, the last point in the collection is connected to the first point of the collection.
Indicates how to handle complex crossing lines.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterRegion.FromCurve(Leadtools.RasterRegionXForm,Leadtools.LeadPoint,System.Single,Leadtools.LeadFillMode)
member.summary: Creates a curved region from a list of points.
member.param: RasterRegionXForm object that LEADTOOLS uses to translate between display coordinates and image coordinates. If you specify **null** in this parameter, the scalar fields default to 1, the offsets default to 0, and the view perspective defaults to the image view perspective.

Collection of LeadPoint objects. The points in the array must be in the order in which the vertices of the polygon are connected. To create the line that closes the polygon, the last point in the array is connected to the first point of the array.
A value that specifies the amount that the curve bends between control points. Values greater than 1 produce unpredictable results.
Indicates how to handle complex crossing lines.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterRegion.FromCurve(Leadtools.RasterRegionXForm,Leadtools.RasterCurve)
member.summary: Creates a curved region.
member.param: RasterRegionXForm object that LEADTOOLS uses to translate between display coordinates and image coordinates. If you specify **null** in this parameter, the scalar fields default to 1, the offsets default to 0, and the view perspective defaults to the image view perspective.
A RasterCurve object that specifies the curve region. You specify the curve using device context coordinates, and LEADTOOLS translates the coordinates using the values specified in the \xform\.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterRegion.FromEllipse(Leadtools.RasterRegionXForm,Leadtools.LeadRect)
member.summary: Creates an elliptical raster region.
member.param: RasterRegionXForm object that LEADTOOLS uses to translate between display coordinates and image coordinates. If you specify **null** in this parameter, the scalar fields default to 1, the offsets default to 0, and the view perspective defaults to the image view perspective.
A LeadRect that represents the bounding rectangle that defines the ellipse.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterRegion.FromPolygon(Leadtools.RasterRegionXForm,Leadtools.LeadPoint,Leadtools.LeadFillMode)
member.summary: Creates a polygonal raster region.

A collection of LeadPoint objects. The points in the collection must be in the order in which the vertices of the polygon are connected. To create the line that closes the polygon, the last point in the collection is connected to the first point of the collection.
Indicates how to handle complex crossing lines.

member.summary: Sets the runtime license for LEADTOOLS and unlocks support for optional features such as LEADTOOLS Imaging Pro, Document and Medical capabilities, or PDF support. After you have obtained a runtime license and a developer key, you can call Leadtools.RasterSupport.SetLicense in your application to disable the nag message.

Character string containing the developer key.

After you have obtained a runtime license and a developer key, you can call Leadtools.RasterSupport.SetLicense in your application to disable the nag message.
member.param: Stream containing the LEADTOOLS runtime license to load.
Character string containing the developer key.

member.summary: Sets the runtime license for LEADTOOLS and unlocks support for optional features such as LEADTOOLS Imaging Pro, Document and Medical capabilities, or PDF support. After you have obtained a runtime license and a developer key, you can call Leadtools.RasterSupport.SetLicense in your application to disable the nag message.

member.name: T:Leadtools.DrawEngineType
member.summary: Draw engine type.

member.name: F:Leadtools.DrawEngineType.DefaultEngine
member.summary: In the Windows Desktop environment, this is an internal rendering engine that uses Windows GDI/GDI+. This engine produces the fastest results for Windows and is used as the default engine in this version of LEADTOOLS.In the other platform environment, this is the same as the DrawEngineType.Multiplatform.

member.name: F:Leadtools.DrawEngineType.Multiplatform
member.summary: This is an internal rendering engine that uses code independent on the operation system. Using this engine will always produce the same exact results in all platform. Currently, this is based on the OpenGL and freetype libraries.

member.name: T:Leadtools.DrawShadowFontMode
member.summary: Shadow font mode.

member.name: F:Leadtools.DrawShadowFontMode.Auto
member.summary: Default mode. Same as SystemFirst in Windows. Same as ShadowFirst in other platforms.

member.name: F:Leadtools.DrawShadowFontMode.SystemFirst
member.summary: Try the system (operating system) first. If the font is not available, try the shadow fonts directory. This is the default mode in Windows.

member.name: F:Leadtools.DrawShadowFontMode.ShadowFirst
member.summary: Try the shadow fonts first. If the font is not available, try the system. This is the default mode in the other platforms.

member.name: T:Leadtools.LeadEventsDispatchMode
member.summary: Specifies the mode used to dispatch LEADTOOLS events.

member.name: F:Leadtools.LeadEventsDispatchMode.Direct
member.summary: Indicates the class can fire events caused by asynchronous methods directly. This provides the best performance.

member.name: F:Leadtools.LeadEventsDispatchMode.UseCoreDispatcher
member.summary: Indicates the class must fire events caused by asynchronous methods using the Core Dispatcher. This reduces performance, but ensures events work in JavaScript applications.

member.name: T:Leadtools.LeadFillMode
member.summary: Specifies how a polygonal shape with crossing lines is filled.

member.name: F:Leadtools.LeadFillMode.Alternate
member.summary: The filled area includes the area between odd-numbered and even-numbered polygon sides on each scan line.

member.name: F:Leadtools.LeadFillMode.Winding
member.summary: All pixels that are inside the resulting exterior lines are filled.

member.name: T:Leadtools.LEADResourceDirectory
member.summary: Specifies the LEADTOOLS resource directory.

member.summary: Indicates the directory for the LEADTOOLS runtime libraries.

member.name: F:Leadtools.LEADResourceDirectory.Fonts
member.summary: Indicates the directory for font files to be used by LEADTOOLS.

member.name: T:Leadtools.LeadSeekOrigin
member.summary: Specifies the position in a stream to use for seeking.

member.name: F:Leadtools.LeadSeekOrigin.Begin
member.summary: Specifies the beginning of a stream.

member.name: F:Leadtools.LeadSeekOrigin.Current
member.summary: Specifies the current position within a stream.

member.name: F:Leadtools.LeadSeekOrigin.End
member.summary: Specifies the end of a stream.

member.name: T:Leadtools.LeadStreamAccess
member.summary: Specifies the type of stream access requested.

member.name: F:Leadtools.LeadStreamAccess.Read
member.summary: Access to read from a stream.

member.name: F:Leadtools.LeadStreamAccess.Write
member.summary: Access to write to a stream.

member.name: F:Leadtools.LeadStreamAccess.ReadWrite
member.summary: Access to read and write to a stream.

member.name: T:Leadtools.LeadStreamMode
member.summary: Specifies how the operating system should open a stream.

member.name: F:Leadtools.LeadStreamMode.Open
member.summary: Specifies that the operating system should create a new stream.

member.name: F:Leadtools.LeadStreamMode.Create
member.summary: Specifies that the operating system should create a new stream. If the stream already exists, it will be overwritten.

member.name: F:Leadtools.LeadStreamMode.Truncate
member.summary: Specifies that the operating system should open an existing stream. When the stream is opened, it should be truncated so that its size is zero bytes.

member.name: T:Leadtools.LeadStreamShare
member.summary: Defines constants for read, write, or read/write access to a stream.

member.name: F:Leadtools.LeadStreamShare.None
member.summary: No access.

member.name: F:Leadtools.LeadStreamShare.Read
member.summary: Read access to the stream. Data can be read from the stream.

member.name: F:Leadtools.LeadStreamShare.Write
member.summary: Write access to the stream. Data can be written to the stream.

member.name: F:Leadtools.LeadStreamShare.ReadWrite
member.summary: Read and write access to the stream. Data can be written to and read from the stream.

member.name: T:Leadtools.LeadTempFileMode
member.summary: Enumeration that indicates whether the temp files are on disk, in memory or a combination of disk and memory.

member.name: F:Leadtools.LeadTempFileMode.Auto
member.summary: Lets LEADTOOLS pick the default mode (behavior might change from one version to another). Currently, it is the same as `DiskAndMemory`

member.name: F:Leadtools.LeadTempFileMode.Disk
member.summary: Disk only, does not use memory to back up temp files.

member.name: F:Leadtools.LeadTempFileMode.DiskAndMemory
member.summary: Uses Memory for small temp files, but disk for large temp files.

member.name: F:Leadtools.LeadTempFileMode.Memory
member.summary: Disables disk, all temp files should be created in memory. Some features might fail with if they require temporary files on disk. The failure might be an out of memory errors or a RasterException with code set to RasterExceptionCode.TempFileDiskDisabled.

member.summary: One or more items were moved within the collection.

member.name: F:Leadtools.NotifyLeadCollectionChangedAction.Reset
member.summary: The content of the collection changed dramatically.

member.summary: Rational

member.summary: Byte

member.name: T:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType
member.summary: List of available metadata comments.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.Artist
member.summary: Person who created the image. (TIFF Comment)

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.Copyright
member.summary: Copyright notice. (TIFF Comment)

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.DateTime
member.summary: Date and time (YYYY:MM:DD HH:MM:SS). The field length is 20, counting the NULL terminator. (TIFF Comment)

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.Description
member.summary: Description of the image. (TIFF Comment)

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.HostComputer
member.summary: Computer and operating system in use. (TIFF Comment)

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.Make
member.summary: Manufacturer of the equipment used to create the image. (TIFF Comment)

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.Model
member.summary: Model name and number of the equipment. (TIFF Comment)

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.NameOfDocument
member.summary: Name of the document from which the image was scanned. (TIFF Comment)

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.NameOfPage
member.summary: Page name from which the image was scanned. (TIFF Comment)

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.Software
member.summary: Name and version of the software package used to create the image. (TIFF Comment)

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.PatientName
member.summary: Patient name (DICOM)

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.PatientId
member.summary: Patient ID (DICOM)

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.PatientBirthdate
member.summary: Patient birth date (DICOM)

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.PatientSex
member.summary: Patient sex (DICOM)

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.StudyInstance
member.summary: Study instance ID (DICOM)

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.StudyDate
member.summary: Study date (DICOM)

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.StudyTime
member.summary: Study time (DICOM)

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.StudyReferringPhysician
member.summary: Referring physician (DICOM)

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.SeriesModality
member.summary: Series modality (DICOM)

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.SeriesId
member.summary: Series ID (DICOM)

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.SeriesNumber
member.summary: Series number (DICOM)

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.ExifVersion
member.summary: Exif version. LEADTOOLS always writes this value as 0110, meaning version 1.1. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii. Length: 4.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.DateTimeOriginal
member.summary: Date and time the original image is captured. The format is YYYY:MM:DD HH:MM:SS. The time is in a 24-hour format, and a blank space is left between the date and the time. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii. Length: 20.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.DateTimeDigitized
member.summary: Date and time the file is generated. If the file is generated directly, as with a digital camera, this is the same as the time the original image is captured. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii. Length: 20.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.ShutterSpeedValue
member.summary: Shutter speed. The unit of measure is APEX. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Rational. Length: 1.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.Aperture
member.summary: Aperture value. This is the ratio of lens aperture for the focal length. The unit of measure is APEX. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.URational. Length: 1.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.Brightness
member.summary: Brightness value. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Rational. Length: 1.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.ExposureBias
member.summary: Exposure bias. This is the value for correcting a biased exposure. The unit of measure is APEX. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Rational. Length: 1.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.MaxAperture
member.summary: Minimum lens f-number. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.URational. Length: 1.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.SubjectDistance
member.summary: Distance from lens to subject (in meters). Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.URational. Length: 1.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.MeteringMode
member.summary: Photometry mode.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.LightSource
member.summary: Light source.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.Flash
member.summary: Flash On/Off. Possible values are 1 for on or 0 for off. Data type: SHORT. Length: 1.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.FocalLength
member.summary: Focal length, measured in millimeters. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.URational. Length: 1.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.ExposureTime
member.summary: Exposure time, expressed as a fraction of a second. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.URational. Length: 1.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.FNumber
member.summary: The actual lens F stop (ratio of lens aperture to focal length). Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.URational. Length: 1.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.MakerNote
member.summary: Maker note. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii. The creator of the file determines the data format.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.UserComment
member.summary: User comment. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii. Length: variable. The first eight bytes specify the data format, and the remainder of the comment is in the specified format.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.SubSecTime
member.summary: Decimal extension for seconds that are specified in the RasterCommentMetadataType.DateTime field. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii. Length: variable.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.SubSecTimeOriginal
member.summary: Decimal extension for seconds that are specified in the RasterCommentMetadataType.DateTimeOriginal field. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii. Length: variable.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.SubSecTimeDigitized
member.summary: Decimal extension for seconds that are specified in the RasterCommentMetadataType. DateTimeDigitized field. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii. Length: variable.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsVersionId
member.summary: Version number of the GPS image file directory (IFD). The current version is 2.0.0.0. This comment must be included when any GPS comments are used. Unlike the RasterCommentMetadataType.ExifVersion comment, this comment is written in bytes. A version written as 2.0.0.0 is actually 0x02000000 when coded. Data type: BYTE. Length: 4.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsLatitudeRef
member.summary: North or south latitude. Possible values are "N" for north and "S" for south. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii. Length: 2.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsLatitude
member.summary: Latitude, expressed as three RasterCommentMetadataDataType.URational values. When expressed in degrees, minutes, and seconds, latitude is written as dd/1,mm/1,ss/1. If degrees and minutes are used as the units, and minutes are written with fractions to two decimal places, then latitude is expressed as dd/1,mmmm/100,0/1. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.URational. Length: 3.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsLongitudeRef
member.summary: East or west longitude. Possible values are "E" for east and "W" for west. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii. Length: 2.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsLongitude
member.summary: The longitude, expressed as three RasterCommentMetadataDataType.URational values. When expressed in degrees, minutes and seconds, longitude is written as ddd/1,mm/1,ss/1. If degrees and minutes are used as the units, and minutes are written with fractions to two decimal places, then longitude is expressed as dd/1,mmmm/100,0/1. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.URational. Length: 3.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsAltitudeRef
member.summary: Reference altitude. In the current version, sea level is used as the reference, which must be zero. The reference unit is meters. Data type: BYTE. Length: 1.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsAltitude
member.summary: Altitude, in meters, relative to the reference altitude. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.URational. Length: 1.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsTimestamp
member.summary: Time stamp in UTC (Coordinated Universal Time) time. The time is expressed as three RasterCommentMetadataDataType.URational values, for hours, minutes, and seconds. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.URational. Length: 3.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsSatellites
member.summary: GPS satellites used for measurement. The coding format is not stipulated. This comment can be used to code information such as the number of satellites, the satellite number, the satellite angle of elevation, its azimuth, and its SNR. If the GPS receiver cannot make a measurement, this comment is NULL. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii. Length: variable.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsStatus
member.summary: Status of the GPS receiver at when the image is recorded. Possible values are "A" when measurement in progress and "V" when measurement is interrupted. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii. Length: 2.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsMeasureMode
member.summary: GPS measurement mode. A value of "2" denotes two-dimensional measurement, and "3" denotes three-dimensional measurement. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii. Length: 2.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsDop
member.summary: DOP (data precision) value. This comment is an HDOP value during two-dimensional measurement and a PDOP value during three-dimensional measurement. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.URational. Length: 1.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsSpeedRef
member.summary: Unit for measuring speed. Possible values are "K" for kilometers, "M" for miles, and "N" for knots. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii. Length: 2.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsSpeed
member.summary: Speed of the GPS receiver. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.URational. Length: 1.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsTrackRef
member.summary: Reference for direction of movement. Possible values are "T" for a true direction and "M" for a magnetic. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii. Length: 2

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsTrack
member.summary: Direction of GPS receiver movement. The range of values is 0.00 to 359.00. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.URational. Length: 1.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsImageDirectionRef
member.summary: Reference for the direction of photography in the recorded image. Possible values are "T" for a true direction and "M" for a magnetic. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii. Length: 2.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsImageDirection
member.summary: Direction of photography in the recorded image. The range of values is 0.00 to 359.00. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.URational. Length: 1.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsMapDatum
member.summary: Geodetic survey data used by the receiver. If the geodetic survey data is restricted to Japan, this tag value is " TOKYO " or "WGS-84". Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii. Length: variable.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsDestinationLatitudeRef
member.summary: North or south latitude for the destination point. Possible values are "N" for north and "S" for south. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii. Length: 2.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsDestinationLatitude
member.summary: Latitude of the destination point. The latitude is expressed as three RasterCommentMetadataDataType.URationalvalues, indicating degrees, minutes and seconds. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.URational. Length: 3.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsDestinationLongitudeRef
member.summary: East or west longitude for the destination point. Possible values are "E" for east and "W" for west. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii. Length: 2.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsDestinationLongitude
member.summary: Longitude of the destination point. The longitude is expressed as three RasterCommentMetadataDataType.URationalvalues, indicating degrees, minutes and seconds. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.URational. Length: 3.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsDestinationBearingRef
member.summary: Reference for the bearing to the destination point. Possible values are "T" for a true direction and "M" for a magnetic. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii. Length: 2.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsDestinationBearing
member.summary: Bearing to the destination point. The range of values is 0.00 to 359.00. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.URational. Length: 1.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsDestinationDistanceRef
member.summary: Unit for measuring distance to the destination point. Possible values are "K" for kilometers, "M" for miles, and "N" for nautical miles. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii. Length: 2.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsDestinationDistance
member.summary: Distance to the destination point. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.URational. Length: 1.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.SupportedFlashPixVersion
member.summary: Supported FlashPix version (Exif 2.0). LEADTOOLS always writes 0100 here. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType. Undefined. Length: 4

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.ColorSpace
member.summary: Color space (Exif 2.0). Specifies whether the color is calibrated or not. LEADTOOLS always writes this value as 1. Data type: SHORT.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.ExposureProgram
member.summary: Exposure program (Exif 2.0) The class of the program used by the camera to set exposure when the picture is taken. Data type: SHORT. Length = 1.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.SpectralSensitivity
member.summary: Spectral sensitivity (Exif) - The spectral sensitivity of each channel of the camera used. It is an ASCII string compatible with the standard developed by the ASTM technical committee. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii. Length: any

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.IsoSpeedRatings
member.summary: ISO speed ratings (Exif) - the ISO speed and the ISO Latitude of the camera or input device as specified in ISO 12232 Data type: SHORT. Length: any

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.OptoElectricCoefficient
member.summary: Optoelectric coefficient (Exif) - Opto-Electric Conversion function specified in ISO 14524. OECF is the relationship between the camera optical input and the image values. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType. Undefined. Length: ANY. This is an array of m rows and n columns.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.RelatedSoundFile
member.summary: Related audio file (Exif) - the name of an audio file related to the image data. The name should be 8 ASCII chars + '.' + 3 chars for extension + NULL. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii. Length: 13.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.FlashEnergy
member.summary: Flash energy (Exif) - the strobe energy at the time the image is captured, as measured in Beam Candle Power Seconds (BPCS) Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.URational. Length: 1

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.SpatialFrequencyResponse
member.summary: Spatial frequency response (Exif) - the camera or input device spatial frequency table and SFR values in the direction of image width, image height and diagonal direction, as specified in ISO 12233. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii. Length: ANY This is an array of m rows and n columns.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.FocalPlaneXResolution
member.summary: Focal plane X Resolution (Exif) - the number of dots per resolution unit on the camera focal plane in the image width (X) direction

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.FocalPlaneYResolution
member.summary: Focal plane Y Resolution (Exif) - the number of dots per inch on the camera focal plane in the image height (Y) direction

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.SubjectLocation
member.summary: Subject location (Exif) - the location of the main subject in the scene. The first value is the X column number and the second is the Y row number. Data type: SHORT. Length: 2

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.ExposureIndex
member.summary: Exposure index (Exif) - the image sensor type on the camera or input device. Data type: SHORT. Length: 1

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.SensingMethod
member.summary: Sensing method (Exif) - the image sensor type on the camera or input device. Data type: SHORT.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.FileSource
member.summary: File source (Exif) - the image source. If a digital camera recorded the image, the value will always be 3, to indicate that the image was recorded on a digital camera. Data type: SHORT.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.SceneType
member.summary: Scene type (Exif) - the type of scene. If a DSC recorded the image, this value will always be 1, indicating that the image was directly photographed. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.CfaPattern
member.summary: CFA Pattern (Exif) - the color filter array (CFA) geometric pattern of the image sensor when a one-chip color sensor was applied. It does not apply to any other sensing methods. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType. Undefined. Length: ANY This is an array m x n (horz x vertical), where the pattern is repeated every m pixels on the horizontal and n pixels on the vertical.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.IptcVersion
member.summary: 2:0, the version of IPTC comments (read-only). Non-repeatable, (min=2 bytes, max=2). This is the only comment that is binary. The first byte is the lower version number (usually 0) and the second byte is the high version number (the current version is 4 - binary 4, not ascii '4'). LEADTOOLS writes 4 here.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.SubjectArea
member.summary: Location and area of the main subject in the overall scene. Data type: SHORT. Count: 2 (Location of the subject is given in X, Y coordinates), 3 (Area of the main subject is given as a circle, X, Y, D, where X and Y are the center coordinates and D is the diameter.) and 4 (Area of the main subject is given as a rectangle, X, Y, W, H, where X and Y are the center coordinates, W is the width or the rectangle and H is the height of the rectangle.).

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.CustomRendered
member.summary: Use of special processing on image data, such as rendering geared toward output. When special processing is performed, the reader is expected to disable or minimize any further processing. Data type: SHORT; Count: 1; Possible Values: 0 ( Normal process), 1 (Custom process), Other (Reserved). Default: 0;

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.ExposureMode
member.summary: Exposure mode set when the image was shot. In auto-bracketing mode the camera shoots a series of frames of the same scene at different exposure settings. Tag: 41986; Data type: SHORT; Count: 1; Possible values are: 0 (Auto exposure), 1 (Manual exposure), 2 (Auto-bracket), Other (Reserved); Default: none.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.WhiteBalance
member.summary: White balance mode set when the image was shot. Data type: SHORT; Count: 1; Possible values are: 0 (Auto white balance), 1 (Manual white balance), Other (Reserved); Default: none.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.DigitalZoomRatio
member.summary: Digital zoom ratio set when the image was shot. If the numerator of the recorded value is 0, the digital zoom was not used. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.URational; Count: 1; Default: none.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.FocalLengthIn35MMFilm
member.summary: Equivalent focal length, assuming a 35mm film camera, in mm. A value of 0 means the focal length is unknown. Note that this comment is different from the RasterCommentMetadataType.FocalLength comment. Data type: SHORT; Count: 1; Default: none.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.SceneCaptureType
member.summary: Type of scene that was shot. It can also be used to record the mode in which the image was shot. Note that this differs from the RasterCommentMetadataType.SceneType comment. Data type: SHORT; Count: 1; Possible values are: 0 (Standard), 1 (Landscape), 2 (Portrait), 3 (Night scene), Other (Reserved); Default: 0.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GainControl
member.summary: Degree of overall image gain adjustment. Data type: SHORT; Count: 1; Possible values are: 0 (None), 1 (Low gain up), 2 (High gain up), 3 (Low gain down), 4 (High gain down), Other (Reserved); Default: none.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.Contrast
member.summary: Direction of contrast processing applied by the camera when the image was shot. Data type: SHORT; Count: 1; Possible values are: 0 ( Normal), 1 (Soft), 2 (Hard), Other (Reserved); Default: 0.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.Saturation
member.summary: Direction of saturation processing applied by the camera when the image was shot. Data type: SHORT; Count: 1; Possible values are: 0 ( Normal), 1 (Low saturation), 2 (High saturation), Other (Reserved); Default: 0.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.Sharpness
member.summary: Direction of sharpness processing applied by the camera when the image was shot. Data type: SHORT; Count: 1; Possible values are: 0 ( Normal), 1 (Soft), 2 (Hard), Other (Reserved); Default: 0.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.DeviceSettingDescription
member.summary: Information on the picture-taking conditions of a particular camera model. Used only to indicate the picture-taking conditions in the reader. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii; Count: Any; The data is recorded in Unicode using SHORT fro the number of display rows and columns and RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii for the camera settings. The Unicode (UCS -2) string including Signature is NULL terminated. The specifics of the Unicode string are as given in ISO/IEC 10464-1. Default: none.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.SubjectDistanceRange
member.summary: Distance to the subject. Data type: SHORT; Count: 1; Possible values are: 0 (Unknown), 1 (Macro), 2 (Close view), 3 (Distant view), Other (Reserved); Default: none.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.ImageUniqueId
member.summary: Identifier assigned uniquely to each image. It is recorded as an ASCII string equivalent to hexadecimal notation and 128-bit fixed length. Tag: 42016; Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Ascii; Count: 33; Default: none

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsProcessingMethod
member.summary: Processing method. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Byte. Length: Any.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsAreaInformation
member.summary: Area. Data type: RasterCommentMetadataDataType.Byte. Length: Any.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsDateStamp
member.summary: Date. Data type: SZ. Length: 11.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.GpsDifferential
member.summary: Differential. Data type: Short. Length: 1.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.FocalPlaneResolutionUnit
member.summary: Focal plane resolution unit (Exif). This is the resolution unit for the RasterCommentMetadataType.FocalPlaneXResolution and RasterCommentMetadataType.FocalPlaneYResolution comments.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCommentMetadataType.Gamma
member.summary: Indicates the value of coefficient gamma.

member.name: T:Leadtools.RasterCompression
member.summary: Indicates the compression type for the image data.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCompression.None
member.summary: Image data is not compressed in memory.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCompression.Rle
member.summary: Image data is compressed using 1-bit RLE compression. This compression is very fast and Lossless. For more information, refer to Speeding Up 1-Bit Documents. This is the same as passing RasterMemoryFlags.Compressed to the RasterImage constructor.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCompression.Super
member.summary: Image data is compressed in memory using LEAD proprietary compression.

member.summary: Source buffer has grayscale data

member.summary: Destination buffer has grayscale data

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterConvertBufferFlags.SourceUseBits
member.summary: LowBit and HighBit apply to the source image

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterConvertBufferFlags.DestinationUseBits

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterConvertBufferFlags.AlphaInit
member.summary: Initialize the alpha values when destination buffer is 32 or 64 bits or pixels

member.name: T:Leadtools.RasterConvertToDibType

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterConvertToDibType.BitmapInfoHeader
member.summary: DIB that uses a BITMAPINFOHEADER.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterConvertToDibType.BitmapV4Header
member.summary: DIB that uses a BITMAPV4HEADER. (Introduced in Windows 95 and Windows NT 4.0).

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterConvertToDibType.BitmapV5Header
member.summary: DIB that uses a BITMAPV5HEADER (Introduced in Windows 2000 and Windows 98).

member.name: T:Leadtools.RasterCurveClose
member.summary: Indicates how to close the curve.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCurveClose.NoClose
member.summary: For n points, draw (n - 3) segments. For example, for points {P0, P1, P2, P3, P4}, draw segments P1P2 and P2P3

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCurveClose.Close
member.summary: For n points draw (n) segments. For example, for points {P0, P1, P2, P3, P4}, draw segments P0P1, P1P2, P2P3, P3P4, P4P0

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCurveClose.PartialClose
member.summary: For n points draw (n - 1) segments. For example, for points {P0, P1, P2, P3, P4}, draw segments P0P1, P1P2, P2P3, P3P4 (but not P4P0)

member.name: T:Leadtools.RasterCurveType
member.summary: Indicates the type of curve that is being defined.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCurveType.Bezier
member.summary: A series of Bézier curves that use the points as control points. In this case, the number of points must be 3n + 1, where n >= 1. For example, number of points can be 4, 7, 10, 13, and so on. The first four points define the first Bézier curve, and each subsequent group of three points defines the next Bézier curve, using the last point of the previous Bézier curve as the starting point.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterCurveType.Standard
member.summary: A smooth curve that goes through all of the points. In this case, there must be at least three points.

member.summary: Indicates the dithering method used for the image.

member.summary: Jarvis method

member.summary: Ordered dithering, which is faster than other methods but is lower in quality

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterDitheringMethod.Clustered
member.summary: Clustered dithering

member.name: T:Leadtools.RasterGetSetOverlayAttributesFlags
member.summary: Determines which attributes are to be retrieved or changed.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterGetSetOverlayAttributesFlags.None
member.summary: No action.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterGetSetOverlayAttributesFlags.Origin
member.summary: The top-left position should be retrieved/changed. RasterOverlayAttributes.Origin contains/will be updated with the new top-left offset.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterGetSetOverlayAttributesFlags.Color
member.summary: The color should be retrieved/changed. RasterOverlayAttributes.Color contains/will be updated with the new color.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterGetSetOverlayAttributesFlags.Flags
member.summary: The flags should be retrieved/changed.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterGetSetOverlayAttributesFlags.BitIndex
member.summary: The corresponding bitplane position should be retrieved/changed. RasterOverlayAttributes.BitPosition contains/will be updated with the new bitplane index.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterGetSetOverlayAttributesFlags.Dicom
member.summary: The DICOM-related attributes should be retrieved/changed.

member.name: T:Leadtools.RasterGetSetOverlayImageMode
member.summary: Determines how to set or retrieve the overlay RasterImage.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterGetSetOverlayImageMode.Copy
member.summary: A copy of the overlay image is retrieved/inserted from/into the overlay list.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterGetSetOverlayImageMode.NoCopy
member.summary: The actual overlay image is retrieved/inserted. No copy is made.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterGetSetOverlayImageMode.Move
member.summary: For RasterImage.GetOverlayImage, the actual overlay image is retrieved. The image is also removed from the overlay list For RasterImage.SetOverlayImage, the overlay image is moved into the overlay list. It will also be reset, so you cannot make changes to it.

member.summary: Reverse ordered grayscale (light to dark)

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterGrayscaleMode.NotOrdered
member.summary: Unordered grayscale

member.name: T:Leadtools.RasterImageAnimationDisposalMethod
member.summary: Used for the disposal methods used after rendering each frame in an animated image.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterImageAnimationDisposalMethod.None
member.summary: Do nothing

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterImageAnimationDisposalMethod.Leave
member.summary: Leave the target image as is

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterImageAnimationDisposalMethod.RestoreBackground
member.summary: Restore the background

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterImageAnimationDisposalMethod.RestorePrevious
member.summary: Restore the previous frame

member.name: T:Leadtools.RasterImageAnimatorState
member.summary: The RasterImageAnimator state.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterImageAnimatorState.PreClear
member.summary: The initial state of the animation (index = -1). The target image will be cleared to the RasterImage.AnimationBackground color of the current frame on the next call

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterImageAnimatorState.PostClear
member.summary: Indicates that the target image has been cleared

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterImageAnimatorState.PreRender
member.summary: Indicates that the current frame will be rendered to the target image on the next call

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterImageAnimatorState.Render
member.summary: Indicates that a frame has been rendered to the target image

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterImageAnimatorState.PostRender
member.summary: Indicates that a frame is in the midst of being rendered to the target image

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterImageAnimatorState.WaitInput
member.summary: Indicates that the animation engine is waiting for user input before moving on to PreDispose

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterImageAnimatorState.WaitDelay
member.summary: Indicates that the animation engine is waiting for a delayed time before moving on to PreDispose

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterImageAnimatorState.WaitInputDelay
member.summary: Indicates that the animation engine is waiting for user input and a delayed time before moving on to PreDispose

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterImageAnimatorState.PreDispose
member.summary: Indicates that the current frame will be disposed of on the next call

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterImageAnimatorState.PostDispose
member.summary: Indicates that the current frame has been disposed of. The index is incremented after processing this state

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterImageAnimatorState.End
member.summary: Indicates that the animation is past the last frame in the list (index = number of frames or pages). The animator will loop to index = 0 on the next call with the state set to PreRender
