member.name: T:Leadtools.RasterMemoryFlags
member.summary: Indicates the type of memory to allocate.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterMemoryFlags.None
member.summary: No flags.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterMemoryFlags.Conventional
member.summary: Use conventional memory.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterMemoryFlags.User
member.summary: Creates an image where the user maintains the data pointer. Some image processing commands, such as RotateCommand and ColorResolutionCommand, need to re-allocate the image data. If you create a bitmap with RasterMemoryFlags.User, and pass it to these command, they will change the bitmap to RasterMemoryFlags.Conventional and re-allocate memory. Your original memory will no longer be used.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterMemoryFlags.Tiled
member.summary: Creates an image where the data pointers are maintained in tiles, useful for very large images.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterMemoryFlags.NoTiled
member.summary: Do not allow tiled images.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterMemoryFlags.Disk
member.summary: Do not use managed memory. Swap to disk only. If the image is allocated as Disk, then the image should not be used in multiple threads.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterMemoryFlags.NoDisk
member.summary: Do not swap to disk using LEAD virtual memory. Windows virtual memory is not affected.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterMemoryFlags.Compressed
member.summary: (Document/Medical only) Allocate an RLE-compressed image. You can use this flag with None or NoDisk. For more information, refer to Speeding Up 1-Bit Documents.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterMemoryFlags.SuperCompressed
member.summary: (Document/Medical only) Allocate a CMP-compressed image. You can use this flag with None or NoDisk. The compression used for 24-bit and 8-bit images is lossy, which means multiple changes to the image can produce some visual loss.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterMemoryFlags.WriteableBitmap
member.summary: No longer supported.

member.name: T:Leadtools.RasterMetadataFlags
member.summary: Indicates the type of metadata.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterMetadataFlags.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterMetadataFlags.Comments
member.summary: Comments

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterMetadataFlags.Tags
member.summary: Tags

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterMetadataFlags.Markers
member.summary: Markers

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterMetadataFlags.GeoKeys
member.summary: GeoKeys

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterMetadataFlags.All
member.summary: (Comments | Tags | Markers | GeoKeys)All (Comments, Tags, Markers and GeoKeys)

member.name: T:Leadtools.RasterPaintAlignMode
member.summary: Determines how to align the image in the destination rectangle.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterPaintAlignMode.Near
member.summary: Align the image to the left (if this is the horizontal alignment) or top (if this is the vertical alignment) of the destination rectangle.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterPaintAlignMode.Center
member.summary: Center the image in the middle of the destination rectangle. If the image size is greater than the destination rectangle size then do not center the image.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterPaintAlignMode.CenterAlways
member.summary: Center the image in the middle of the destination rectangle.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterPaintAlignMode.Far
member.summary: Align the image to the right (if this is the horizontal alignment) or bottom (if this is the vertical alignment) of the destination rectangle.

member.name: T:Leadtools.RasterPaintSizeMode
member.summary: Determines how to fit the image in the destination rectangle.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterPaintSizeMode.Normal
member.summary: Normal, no sizing

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterPaintSizeMode.Fit
member.summary: Fit the image into the destination rectangle while maintaining the aspect ratio. If the image size is smaller than the destination rectangle, no resizing is done

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterPaintSizeMode.FitAlways
member.summary: Always fit the image into the destination rectangle while maintaining the aspect ratio even if the image size is smaller than the destination rectangle

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterPaintSizeMode.FitWidth
member.summary: Fit the image width to be the size of the width of the destination rectangle while maintaining the aspect ratio

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterPaintSizeMode.Stretch
member.summary: Fit the image to fill the destination rectangle. Aspect ratio might not be maintained.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterPaintSizeMode.FitHeight
member.summary: Fit the image height to be the size of the height of the destination rectangle while maintaining the aspect ratio

member.name: T:Leadtools.RasterPaletteWindowLevelFlags
member.summary: Indicates how the range is used to fill and type of the lookup table and whether it contains signed or unsigned data.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterPaletteWindowLevelFlags.None
member.summary: Default

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterPaletteWindowLevelFlags.Inside
member.summary: Fill the lookup table between Low and High. ( inside the Low...High range )

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterPaletteWindowLevelFlags.Outside
member.summary: Fill the LUT below the low and above the high parameters of WindowLevelFillLookupTable and everything in between.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterPaletteWindowLevelFlags.Linear
member.summary: Lookup table is linear

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterPaletteWindowLevelFlags.Exponential
member.summary: Lookup table is exponential

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterPaletteWindowLevelFlags.Logarithmic
member.summary: Lookup table is logarithmic

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterPaletteWindowLevelFlags.Sigmoid
member.summary: Lookup table is sigmoid

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterPaletteWindowLevelFlags.Signed
member.summary: The lookup table data is signed

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterPaletteWindowLevelFlags.DicomStyle
member.summary: Fill using the startColor and endColor parameters of WindowLevelFillLookupTable colors only.

member.name: T:Leadtools.RasterRegionCombineMode
member.summary: Controls the creation of an image region.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterRegionCombineMode.And
member.summary: The resulting region includes only the intersection of the existing region and the new one. The following example shows the result, where the rectangles represent the existing region, the ellipse represents the new one, and the shaded area represents the resulting region.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterRegionCombineMode.Set
member.summary: The resulting region includes only the new region. The existing region, if any, is discarded. The following example shows the result, where the ellipse is the new region and the shaded area is the resulting region.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterRegionCombineMode.AndNotImage
member.summary: The resulting region includes the intersection of the area outside the existing region and the area inside the new region. The following example shows the result, where the rectangle is the existing region, the ellipse is the new one, and the shaded area is the resulting region.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterRegionCombineMode.AndNotRegion
member.summary: The resulting region includes the intersection of the area inside the existing region and the area outside the new region. The following example shows the result, where the rectangle is the existing region, the ellipse is the new one, and the shaded area is the resulting region.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterRegionCombineMode.Or
member.summary: The resulting region includes the area inside the existing region and the area inside the new region. The following example shows the result, where the rectangle is the existing region, the ellipse is the new one, and the shaded area is the resulting region.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterRegionCombineMode.Xor
member.summary: The resulting region includes the area inside the existing region and the area inside the new region, except for any areas where the two intersect. The following example shows the result, where the rectangle is the existing region, the ellipse is the new one, and the shaded area is the resulting region.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterRegionCombineMode.SetNot
member.summary: The resulting region includes everything in the image, except the new region. The existing region, if any, is discarded. The following example shows the result, where the ellipse is the new region and the shaded area is the resulting region.

member.name: T:Leadtools.RasterSizeFlags
member.summary: Flags which control the behavior of image resize methods.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterSizeFlags.None
member.summary: Resize normally

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterSizeFlags.FavorBlack
member.summary: (Document/Medical only) Preserve black objects when making the image smaller. This option affects only 1-bit, black-and-white images, where it prevents the disappearance of thin lines. You can use a bitwise OR ( ¦ ) to combine this flag with another one.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterSizeFlags.Resample
member.summary: Use linear interpolation and averaging to produce a higher-quality image

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterSizeFlags.Bicubic
member.summary: Use bicubic interpolation and averaging to produce a higher quality image. This is slower than Resample

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterSizeFlags.ScaleToGray
member.summary: (Document/Medical only). Use interpolation to display black and white images using shades of gray when the image is resized. This improves the readability when the image is scaled up or down. The generated image is 8-bit grayscale, so this option should be used only for black and white images.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterSizeFlags.OldResample
member.summary: Use the old resample algorithm from LEADTOOLS 14.5.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterSizeFlags.PremultiplyAlpha
member.summary: Premultiply the alpha channel values when performing resize.

member.name: T:Leadtools.RasterSupportType
member.summary: Indicates the optional LEADTOOLS feature to check.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterSupportType.Document
member.summary: Support for LEADTOOLS Document features (ABC, ABIC, JPEG 2000, JBIG2, NITF, CMW, Document Cleanup, Annotations, JPIP and more). Also includes support for 12 bit grayscale, 16-bit grayscale, 48-bit color and 64-bit images. A LEADTOOLS Document license is required.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterSupportType.Barcodes1D
member.summary: Support for reading and writing Linear bar codes. This is available in the LEADTOOLS Barcode 1D Module.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterSupportType.Barcodes2D
member.summary: Support for reading and writing 2D bar codes. This is available in the LEADTOOLS Barcode 2D Module.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterSupportType.RasterPdfRead
member.summary: Support for loading PDF, PS and EPS file formats as raster images. Available in selected LEADTOOLS products. If this support is locked, the PDF, PS and EPS files will not be loaded.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterSupportType.RasterPdfSave
member.summary: Support for saving raster images as a PDF file. Available in selected LEADTOOLS products. Includes support for MRC PDF compression and JBIG2 support.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterSupportType.PdfAdvanced
member.summary: Support for advanced PDF features.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterSupportType.Jbig2

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterSupportType.OcrLEAD

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterSupportType.OcrPlus
member.summary: (Deprecated) Support for the OCR features provided by the OCR Plus engine. OCR add-on to Document and Medical Imaging toolkits.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterSupportType.OcrOmniPage
member.summary: Support for the OCR features provided by the LEADTOOLS OCR Module - OmniPage Engine. OCR add-on to Document and Medical Imaging toolkits.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterSupportType.OcrOmniPageAsian

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterSupportType.OcrOmniPageArabic

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterSupportType.OcrOmniPagePdfOutput

member.summary: Indicates whether window level changes are used by the paint and image processing functions or only by the paint functions.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterWindowLevelMode.Paint
member.summary: Window level changes used only by the paint functions

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterWindowLevelMode.PaintAndProcessing
member.summary: Window level changes used for both paint and image processing functions

member.name: T:Leadtools.RasterYUVFormat
member.summary: Used with SetYUVData and GetYUVData to specify the YUV data format.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterYUVFormat.YV12
member.summary: Planar Y, U, V data using 4:1:1 (aka 4:2:0) subsampling. The U and V planes are half the width and height of the Y plane. The Y plane is followed immediately by the U (Cb) plane, which is followed immediately by the V (Cr) plane. The YUV data is 12 bits/pixel (each 2x2 pixels are described by 6 bytes).

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterYUVFormat.NV12
member.summary: A Y plane followed by interleaved plane of UV data. There are half as many U and V samples as Y samples in both width and height. In other words, for each 2x2 square of Y pixels, there is only one corresponding U, V pair. The YUV data is 12 bits/pixel (each 2x2 pixels are described by 6 bytes).

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterYUVFormat.NV21
member.summary: A Y plane followed by interleaved plane of VU data. Similar to NV12 data, except that the order of UV samples is reversed. The YUV data is 12 bits/pixel (each 2x2 pixels are described by 6 bytes).

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterYUVFormat.YUY2
member.summary: Interleaved 4:2:2 YUYV data. Each two horizontal pixels have the same U and V values. The YUV data is 16 bits/pixel (each 2 pixels are described by 4 bytes).
